title: Elle Macpherson, 55, shows off results of lymphatic drainage treatment
text:
She was nicknamed 'The Body' by Time magazine in 1989.

And Australian supermodel Elle Macpherson revealed the secret behind her enviably flat stomach in an Instagram post on Sunday.

Sharing before and after photos, the 55-year-old said she relies on a lymphatic drainage treatment by expert Sheila Perez.

One Elle of a body! Macpherson, 55, (pictured) revealed the secret behind her enviably flat stomach in an Instagram post on Sunday

'She's back @sheilamsperez - with her exclusive Perez method for manual lymph drainage,' Elle addressed her 475,000 Instagram followers.

'I'm a huge fan of non-invasive wellness treatments and this is one of the best - for more information on why lymphatic drainage is so important go to @sheilamsperez - and the beautiful bi-product is (a) sculpted body.'

Elle went on to plug her own supplement brand WelleCo, adding: 'Perfect when combined with @welleco products - sleep, movement, water and clean food.'

The mother-of-two accompanied the caption with before and after shots, one of which saw Elle reclining on a bed with her already taut tummy exposed.

Before shot: The mother-of-two shared a photo of her already taut tummy exposed, prior to a lymphatic drainage treatment performed by expert Sheila Perez

After shot: Elle shared an after shot with her mid-section visibly flatter, with not an inch to pinch

Incredible transformation: Elle was clearly impressed with the results, adding the text 'wow' to the photo

Two after shots saw Elle's stomach less bloated and visibly flatter with not an inch to pinch.

Lymphatic drainage is a rhythmical massage treatment performed to stimulate the circulation of lymph fluid around the body.

It is purported to rapidly speed up the removal of wastes and toxins from the lymphatic system.

Speaking to Harper's Bazaar Australia in January, Elle said she aims to exercise each day at 6.30am.

Treatment: Lymphatic drainage is a rhythmical massage treatment performed to stimulate the circulation of lymph fluid around the body, rapidly speeding up removal of wastes and toxins

'I'll either do some yoga or I'll jump on my bike and ride to the beach for a swim. If I'm on the road, I'll bring my running shoes and go for a jog or walk - I love to explore any new surroundings and getting outside.'

Elle, who has covered the Sports Illustrated Swimsuit Issue a record five times, said she usually eats breakfast at 8am.

'Sometimes it's a Nourishing Protein smoothie made with hemp milk, half a banana, and one scoop of WelleCo Nourishing Protein in chocolate.

'If I want something hot, I'll have one poached egg on sunflower or wheat-free dark rye bread, oatmeal with agave, or a chia tea pudding soaked in almond milk.'

Elle added that her sweet treats are dark chocolate, espresso and whipped cream.

authors: Kristy Johnson For Daily Mail Australia
